/* Legislation */ Looks good, removed section tag

Reverted POV-motivated edit and re-worded - see Talk page. Remove duplicate points. Restrain Amero-centrism that would be better on [[Gun politics in the United States]].
/* Summary of positions */ Removed reference to the "right... of governments to enact firearm regulations" because that is a POV of the type being listed in this section, not a fact in this context.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 145791088 by [[Special:Contributions/12.48.196.9|12.48.196.9]] ([[User talk:12.48.196.9|talk]]) governments certainly do have rights see [[Sovereignty]]
/* Summary of positions */ Governments don't have rights, but they do have authority.
/* Balance of power */ What the hell? What on earth do tampa refugees have to do with firearm owners? Patently untrue.
/* Arguments */ further edit... Please change this all back when you have sources which actually do talk about homicide...
/* Arguments */ The title of the chart itself says that it relates gun ownership to _gun related suicide_! Nothing about homicide.
/* Degrees of gun legislation */ last time I checked the UK was in the western world and has a comparable policy
